          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              <mr-launch-overview class="main-item" hidden=""><!---->

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */

          margin-top: 0.5em;

              <span></span>Anywhere<span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>

                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                  <!---->:
                </span>

              <!---->
            </div>

                  <!---->:
                </span>

              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          </div>
        <div class="bottom-section-cell">
          <h3>Blocking:</h3>
          <div class="bottom-section-content">
            <!---->
              <mr-issue-link>
              </mr-issue-link>
              <br>
            <!---->
          </div>
        </div>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<span class="line"><!---->NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<!----></span><br><br>Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<span class="line"><!---->Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<!----></span><br><br>[1] -<span class="line"><!---->[1] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[2] -<span class="line"><!---->[2] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[3] - <span class="line"><!---->[3] - <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<!----></a><br>[4] - <span class="line"><!---->[4] - <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/common/features.cc;l=122;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/common/features.cc;l=122;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/common/features.cc;l=122;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>89.0.4389.114 [Stable]<span class="line"><!---->89.0.4389.114 [Stable]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>No user interaction (extension) - cooler<span class="line"><!---->No user interaction (extension) - cooler<!----></span><br>1. Install the attached extension (ext) and allow in incognito <span class="line"><!---->1. Install the attached extension (ext) and allow in incognito <!----></span>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api"><!---->https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api<!----></a><br>2. Host child.html with a web server<span class="line"><!---->2. Host child.html with a web server<!----></span><br>3. python copy_mojo_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/src/out/x64.asan mojo<span class="line"><!---->3. python copy_mojo_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/src/out/x64.asan mojo<!----></span><br>4. run ./out/x64.asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --ignore-certificate-errors --load-extension=/path/to/ext<span class="line"><!---->4. run ./out/x64.asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --ignore-certificate-errors --load-extension=/path/to/ext<!----></span><br><br>Note: Allow incognito is just needed because I'm using the chrome.windows api to simulate closing a browser window.<span class="line"><!---->Note: Allow incognito is just needed because I'm using the chrome.windows api to simulate closing a browser window.<!----></span><br><br>User interaction (exit browser)<span class="line"><!---->User interaction (exit browser)<!----></span><br>1. Host child.html with a web server<span class="line"><!---->1. Host child.html with a web server<!----></span><br>2. Open incognito browser (can be another chrome instance, guest view, etc - we just need two BrowserContext instances)<span class="line"><!---->2. Open incognito browser (can be another chrome instance, guest view, etc - we just need two BrowserContext instances)<!----></span><br>3. Navigate to to <span class="line"><!---->3. Navigate to to <!----></span>https://localhost:8080/child.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost:8080/child.html"><!---->https://localhost:8080/child.html<!----></a><br>4. cc<!----></span><br>==16466==ABORTING<span class="line"><!---->==16466==ABORTING<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        AFAIK we treat UaF as high severity (the example given by <span class="line"><!---->AFAIK we treat UaF as high severity (the example given by <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity<!----></a> for "Memory corruption in the browser process that can only be triggered from a compromised renderer, leading to a sandbox escape" was also a UaF)<span class="line"><!----> for "Memory corruption in the browser process that can only be triggered from a compromised renderer, leading to a sandbox escape" was also a UaF)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thank you for the report!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report!<!----></span><br><br>Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <span class="line"><!---->Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <span class="line"><!---->The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <!----></span><br><br>I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<span class="line"><!---->I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<span class="line"><!---->Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<!----></span><br><br>tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<span class="line"><!---->tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a>: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `<a href="">` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<span class="line"><!---->: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `&lt;a href=""&gt;` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<span class="line"><!---->before dereferencing BrowserContext. possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<!----></span><br>before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<span class="line"><!---->before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }

        }

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;

          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          
            Close
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<span class="line"><!---->NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<!----></span><br><br>Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<span class="line"><!---->Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<!----></span><br><br>[1] -<span class="line"><!---->[1] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[2] -<span class="line"><!---->[2] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[3] - <span class="line"><!---->[3] - <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<!----></a><br>[4] - <span class="line"><!---->[4] - <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/common/features.cc;l=122;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/common/features.cc;l=122;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/common/features.cc;l=122;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>89.0.4389.114 [Stable]<span class="line"><!---->89.0.4389.114 [Stable]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>No user interaction (extension) - cooler<span class="line"><!---->No user interaction (extension) - cooler<!----></span><br>1. Install the attached extension (ext) and allow in incognito <span class="line"><!---->1. Install the attached extension (ext) and allow in incognito <!----></span>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api"><!---->https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api<!----></a><br>2. Host child.html with a web server<span class="line"><!---->2. Host child.html with a web server<!----></span><br>3. python copy_mojo_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/src/out/x64.asan mojo<span class="line"><!---->3. python copy_mojo_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/src/out/x64.asan mojo<!----></span><br>4. run ./out/x64.asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --ignore-certificate-errors --load-extension=/path/to/ext<span class="line"><!---->4. run ./out/x64.asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --ignore-certificate-errors --load-extension=/path/to/ext<!----></span><br><br>Note: Allow incognito is just needed because I'm using the chrome.windows api to simulate closing a browser window.<span class="line"><!---->Note: Allow incognito is just needed because I'm using the chrome.windows api to simulate closing a browser window.<!----></span><br><br>User interaction (exit browser)<span class="line"><!---->User interaction (exit browser)<!----></span><br>1. Host child.html with a web server<span class="line"><!---->1. Host child.html with a web server<!----></span><br>2. Open incognito browser (can be another chrome instance, guest view, etc - we just need two BrowserContext instances)<span class="line"><!---->2. Open incognito browser (can be another chrome instance, guest view, etc - we just need two BrowserContext instances)<!----></span><br>3. Navigate to to <span class="line"><!---->3. Navigate to to <!----></span>https://localhost:8080/child.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost:8080/child.html"><!---->https://localhost:8080/child.html<!----></a><br>4. Close the browser<span class="line"><!---->4. Close the browser<!----></span><br><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==16466==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x6120032bc240 at pc 0x7ffc7ef62948<!----></span><br>READ of size 8 at 0x6120032bc240 thread T0 (chrome)<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 8 at 0x6120032bc240 thread T0 (chrome)<!----></span><br>    #0 0x55ece85af112         AFAIK we treat UaF as high severity (the example given by <span class="line"><!---->AFAIK we treat UaF as high severity (the example given by <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity<!----></a> for "Memory corruption in the browser process that can only be triggered from a compromised renderer, leading to a sandbox escape" was also a UaF)<span class="line"><!----> for "Memory corruption in the browser process that can only be triggered from a compromised renderer, leading to a sandbox escape" was also a UaF)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thank you for the report!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report!<!----></span><br><br>Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <span class="line"><!---->Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <span class="line"><!---->The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <!----></span><br><br>I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<span class="line"><!---->I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<span class="line"><!---->Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<!----></span><br><br>tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<span class="line"><!---->tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a>: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `<a href="">` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<span class="line"><!---->: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `&lt;a href=""&gt;` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296"><!---->6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296<!----></a><br>Author: Brendon Tiszka <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Brendon Tiszka &lt;<!----></span>btiszka@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/btiszka@gmail.com"><!---->btiszka@gmail.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Apr 20 15:45:03 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Apr 20 15:45:03 2021<!----></span><br><br>M86-LTS: Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<span class="line"><!---->M86-LTS: Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<!----></span><br><br>Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<span class="line"><!---->Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<!----></span><br>before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<span class="line"><!---->before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<!----></span><br><br>The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<span class="line"><!---->The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<span class="line"><!---->before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<!----></span><br>outlive BrowserContext.<span class="line"><!---->outlive BrowserContext.<!----></span><br><br>R=​<span class="line"><!---->R=​<!----></span>lukasza@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/lukasza@chromium.org"><!---->lukasza@chromium.org<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>ryansturm@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ryansturm@chromium.org"><!---->ryansturm@chromium.org<!----></a><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
