        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

            Issue 1197904: Security: UAF in NavigationPredictor
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1197904: Security: UAF in NavigationPredictor
          </h1>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<span class="line"><!---->NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<!----></span><br><br>Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<span class="line"><!---->Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<!----></span><br><br>[1] -<span class="line"><!---->[1] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[2] -<span class="line"><!---->[2] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[3] - <span class="line"><!---->[3] - <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<!----></a><br>[4] - <span class="line"><!---->[4] - <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/common/features.cc;l=122;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/common/features.cc;l=122;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/common/features.cc;l=122;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>89.0.4389.114 [Stable]<span class="line"><!---->89.0.4389.114 [Stable]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>No user interaction (extension) - cooler<span class="line"><!---->No user interaction (extension) - cooler<!----></span><br>1. Install the attached extension (ext) and allow in incognito <span class="line"><!---->1. Install the attached extension (ext) and allow in incognito <!----></span>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api"><!---->https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api<!----></a><br>2. Host child.html with a web server<span class="line"><!---->2. Host child.html with a web server<!----></span><br>3. python copy_mojo_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/src/out/x64.asan mojo<span class="line"><!---->3. python copy_mojo_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/src/out/x64.asan mojo<!----></span><br>4. run ./out/x64.asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --ignore-certificate-errors --load-extension=/path/to/ext<span class="line"><!---->4. run ./out/x64.asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --ignore-certificate-errors --load-extension=/path/to/ext<!----></span><br><br>Note: Allow incognito is just needed because I'm using the chrome.windows api to simulate closing a browser window.<span class="line"><!---->Note: Allow incognito is just needed because I'm using the chrome.windows api to simulate closing a browser window.<!----></span><br><br>User interaction (exit browser)<span class="line"><!---->User interaction (exit browser)<!----></span><br>1. Host child.html with a web server<span class="line"><!---->1. Host child.html with a web server<!----></span><br>2. Open incognito browser (can be another chrome instance, guest view, etc - we just need two BrowserContext instances)<span class="line"><!---->2. Open incognito browser (can be another chrome instance, guest view, etc - we just need two BrowserContext instances)<!----></span><br>3. Navigate to to <span class="line"><!---->3. Navigate to to <!----></span>https://localhost:8080/child.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost:8080/child.html"><!---->https://localhost:8080/child.html<!----></a><br>4.         AFAIK we treat UaF as high severity (the example given by <span class="line"><!---->AFAIK we treat UaF as high severity (the example given by <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity<!----></a> for "Memory corruption in the browser process that can only be triggered from a compromised renderer, leading to a sandbox escape" was also a UaF)<span class="line"><!----> for "Memory corruption in the browser process that can only be triggered from a compromised renderer, leading to a sandbox escape" was also a UaF)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thank you for the report!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report!<!----></span><br><br>Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <span class="line"><!---->Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <span class="line"><!---->The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <!----></span><br><br>I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<span class="line"><!---->I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<span class="line"><!---->Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<!----></span><br><br>tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<span class="line"><!---->tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a>: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `<a href="">` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<span class="line"><!---->: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `&lt;a href=""&gt;` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Your change meets the bar and is auto-approved for M91. Please go ahead and merge the CL to branch 4472 (refs/branch-heads/4472) manually.         re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c25<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c25"><!---->#c25<!----></a> yes, this should be a complete band-aid fix. I've filed <span class="line"><!----> yes, this should be a complete band-aid fix. I've filed <!----></span>Issue 1199367<span class="line"><!---->Issue 1199367<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>to clean it up and make the class more robust to these kinds of issues. I want to keep the bug open until it is merged to M90 tomorrow morning though, is that ok?<span class="line"><!---->to clean it up and make the class more robust to these kinds of issues. extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }

          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>


      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<span class="line"><!---->NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<!----></span><br><br>Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<span class="line"><!---->Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<!----></span><br><br>[1] -<span class="line"><!---->[1] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[2] -<span class="line"><!---->[2] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[3] - <span class="line"><!---->[3] - <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<!----></a><br>[4] - <span class="line"><!---->[4] - <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/common/features.cc;l=122;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/common/features.cc;l=122;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/common/features.cc;l=122;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>89.0.4389.114 [Stable]<span class="line"><!---->89.0.4389.114 [Stable]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>No user interaction (extension) - cooler<span class="line"><!---->No user interaction (extension) - cooler<!----></span><br>1. Install the attached extension (ext) and allow in incognito <span class="line"><!---->1. Install the attached extension (ext) and allow in incognito <!----></span>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api"><!---->https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api<!----></a><br>2. Host child.html with a web server<span class="line"><!---->2. Host child.html with a web server<!----></span><br>3. python copy_mojo_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/src/out/x64.asan mojo<span class="line"><!---->3. python copy_mojo_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/src/out/x64.asan mojo<!----></span><br>4. run ./out/x64.asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --ignore-certificate-errors --load-extension=/path/to/ext<span class="line"><!---->4. run ./out/x64.asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --ignore-certificate-errors --load-extension=/path/to/ext<!----></span><br><br>Note: Allow incognito is just needed because I'm using the chrome.windows api to simulate closing a browser window.<span class="line"><!---->Note: Allow incognito is just needed because I'm using the chrome.windows api to simulate closing a browser window.<!----></span><br><br>User interaction (exit browser)<span class="line"><!---->User interaction (exit browser)<!----></span><br>1. Host child.html with a web server<span class="line"><!---->1. Host child.html with a web server<!----></span><br>2. Open incognito browser (can be another chrome instance, guest view, etc - we just need two BrowserContext instances)<span class="line"><!---->2. Open incognito browser (can be another chrome instance, guest view, etc - we just need two BrowserContext instances)<!----></span><br>3. Navigate to to <span class="line"><!---->3. Navigate to to <!----></span>https://localhost:8080/child.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost:8080/child.html"><!---->https://localhost:8080/child.html<!----></a><br>4. Close the browser<span class="line"><!---->4. Close the browser<!----></span><br><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==16466==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x6120032bc240 at pc 0x55ece85af113 bp 0x7ffc7ef62950 sp 0x7ffc7ef62948<span class="line"><!---->==16466==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x6120032bc240 at pc 0x55ece85af113 bp 0x7ffc7ef62950 sp 0x7ffc7ef62948<!----></span><br>READ of size 8 at 0x6120032bc240 thread T0 (chrome)<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 8 at 0x6120032bc240 thread T0 (chrome)<!----></span><br>    #0 0x55ece85af112 in NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick(mojo::StructPtr<blink::mojom::AnchorElementMetrics>) ./../../chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc:509:25<span class="line"><!---->    #0 0x55ece85af112 in NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick(mojo::StructPtr&lt;blink::mojom::AnchorElementMetrics&gt;) ./../../chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc:509:25<!----></span><br>    #1 0x55ecdf49c129 in blink::mojom::AnchorElementMetricsHostStubDispatch::Accept(blink::mojom::AnchorElementMetricsHost*, mojo::Message*)         AFAIK we treat UaF as high severity (the example given by <span class="line"><!---->AFAIK we treat UaF as high severity (the example given by <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity<!----></a> for "Memory corruption in the browser process that can only be triggered from a compromised renderer, leading to a sandbox escape" was also a UaF)<span class="line"><!----> for "Memory corruption in the browser process that can only be triggered from a compromised renderer, leading to a sandbox escape" was also a UaF)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Thank you for the report!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report!<!----></span><br><br>Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <span class="line"><!---->Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <span class="line"><!---->The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <!----></span><br><br>I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<span class="line"><!---->I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<span class="line"><!---->Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<!----></span><br><br>tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<span class="line"><!---->tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a>: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `<a href="">` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<span class="line"><!---->: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `&lt;a href=""&gt;` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296"><!---->6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296<!----></a><br>Author: Brendon Tiszka <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Brendon Tiszka &lt;<!----></span>btiszka@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/btiszka@gmail.com"><!---->btiszka@gmail.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Apr 20 15:45:03 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Apr 20 15:45:03 2021<!----></span><br><br>M86-LTS: Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<span class="line"><!---->M86-LTS: Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<!----></span><br><br>Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<span class="line"><!---->Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<!----></span><br>before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<span class="line"><!---->before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<!----></span><br><br>The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<span class="line"><!---->The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<span class="line"><!---->before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<!----></span><br>outlive BrowserContext.<span class="line"><!---->outlive BrowserContext.<!----></span><br><br>R=​<span class="line"><!---->R=​<!----></span>lukasza@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/lukasza@chromium.org"><!---->lukasza@chromium.org<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>ryansturm@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ryansturm@chromium.org"><!---->ryansturm@chromium.org<!----></a><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by btiszka@gmail.com (Apr 11, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by btiszka@gmail.com (Apr 11, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by btiszka@gmail.com (Apr 11, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by btiszka@gmail.com (Apr 11, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<span class="line"><!---->NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<!----></span><br><br>Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<span class="line"><!---->Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. cooler<span class="line"><!---->No user interaction (extension) - cooler<!----></span><br>1.           Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1197904#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

        Thank you for the report!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report!<!----></span><br><br>Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <span class="line"><!---->Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <span class="line"><!---->The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <!----></span><br><br>I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<span class="line"><!---->I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<span class="line"><!---->Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<!----></span><br><br>tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<span class="line"><!---->tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a>: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `<a href="">` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<span class="line"><!---->: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `&lt;a href=""&gt;` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7313a810ae0b1361cbe8453bc5496654dee24c76<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7313a810ae0b1361cbe8453bc5496654dee24c76"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7313a810ae0b1361cbe8453bc5496654dee24c76<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>7313a810ae0b1361cbe8453bc5496654dee24c76<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/7313a810ae0b1361cbe8453bc5496654dee24c76"><!---->7313a810ae0b1361cbe8453bc5496654dee24c76<!----></a><br>Author: Brendon Tiszka <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Brendon Tiszka &lt;<!----></span>btiszka@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/btiszka@gmail.com"><!---->btiszka@gmail.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Apr 13 18:11:13 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Apr 13 18:11:13 2021<!----></span><br><br>Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<span class="line"><!---->Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<!----></span><br><br>Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<span class="line"><!---->Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<!----></span><br>before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<span class="line"><!---->before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<!----></span><br><br>The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<span class="line"><!---->The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<span class="line"><!---->before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<!----></span><br>outlive BrowserContext.<span class="line"><!---->outlive BrowserContext.<!----></span><br><br>R=<span class="line"><!---->R=<!----></span>lukasza@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/lukasza@chromium.org"><!---->lukasza@chromium.org<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, 21:28:53 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Apr 14 21:28:53 2021<!----></span><br><br>Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<span class="line"><!---->Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<!----></span><br><br>Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<span class="line"><!---->Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<!----></span><br>before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<span class="line"><!---->before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<!----></span><br><br>The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<span class="line"><!---->The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<span class="line"><!---->before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<!----></span><br>outlive BrowserContext.<span class="line"><!---->outlive BrowserContext.<!----></span><br><br>R=​<span it.<!----></span><br><br>The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<span class="line"><!---->The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<span class="line"><!---->before dereferencing BrowserContext. possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<!----></span><br>before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<span class="line"><!---->before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<!----></span><br><br>The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<span class="line"><!---->The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<span class="line"><!---->before dereferencing BrowserContext.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<span class="line"><!---->NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<!----></span><br><br>Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<span class="line"><!---->Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<!----></span><br><br>[1] -<span class="line"><!---->[1] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[2] -<span class="line"><!---->[2] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[3] - <span class="line"><!---->[3] - <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<!----></a><br>[4] - cooler<span class="line"><!---->No user interaction (extension) - cooler<!----></span><br>1. Install the attached extension (ext) and allow in incognito <span class="line"><!---->1. Install the attached extension (ext) and allow in incognito <!----></span>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api"><!---->https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api<!----></a><br>2. Host child.html with a web server<span class="line"><!---->2. Host child.html with a web server<span class="line"><!---->1. Host child.html with a web server<!----></span><br>2. Open incognito browser (can be another chrome instance, guest view, etc - we just need two BrowserContext instances)<span class="line"><!---->2. Open incognito browser (can be another chrome instance, guest view, etc - we just need two BrowserContext instances)<!----></span><br>3. Navigate to to <span class="line"><!---->3.         Thank you for the report!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report!<!----></span><br><br>Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <span class="line"><!---->Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <span class="line"><!---->The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <!----></span><br><br>I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<span class="line"><!---->I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<span class="line"><!---->Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<!----></span><br><br>tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<span class="line"><!---->tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a>: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `<a href="">` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<span class="line"><!---->: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `&lt;a href=""&gt;` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>

        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<span class="line"><!---->NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<!----></span><br><br>Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<span class="line"><!---->Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<!----></span><br><br>[1] -<span class="line"><!---->[1] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[2] -<span class="line"><!---->[2] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[3] -         Thank you for the report!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report!<!----></span><br><br>Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <span class="line"><!---->Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <span class="line"><!---->The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <!----></span><br><br>I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<span class="line"><!---->I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<span class="line"><!---->Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<!----></span><br><br>tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<span class="line"><!---->tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a>: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `<a href="">` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<span class="line"><!---->: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `&lt;a href=""&gt;` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
