        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7313a810ae0b1361cbe8453bc5496654dee24c76<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7313a810ae0b1361cbe8453bc5496654dee24c76"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7313a810ae0b1361cbe8453bc5496654dee24c76<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>7313a810ae0b1361cbe8453bc5496654dee24c76<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/7313a810ae0b1361cbe8453bc5496654dee24c76"><!---->7313a810ae0b1361cbe8453bc5496654dee24c76<!----></a><br>Author: Brendon Tiszka <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Brendon Tiszka &lt;<!----></span>btiszka@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/btiszka@gmail.com"><!---->btiszka@gmail.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Apr 13 18:11:13 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Apr 13 18:11:13 2021<!----></span><br><br>Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<span class="line"><!---->Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<!----></span><br><br>Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<span class="line"><!---->Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<!----></span><br>before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<span class="line"><!---->before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<!----></span><br><br>The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<span class="line"><!---->The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<span class="line"><!---->before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<!----></span><br>outlive BrowserContext.<span class="line"><!---->outlive BrowserContext.<!----></span><br><br>R=<span class="line"><!---->R=<!----></span>lukasza@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/lukasza@chromium.org"><!---->lukasza@chromium.org<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, 21:28:53 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Apr 14 21:28:53 2021<!----></span><br><br>Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<span class="line"><!---->Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<!----></span><br><br>Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<span class="line"><!---->Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<!----></span><br>before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<span class="line"><!---->before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<!----></span><br><br>The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<span class="line"><!---->The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<span class="line"><!---->before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<!----></span><br>outlive BrowserContext.<span class="line"><!---->outlive BrowserContext.<!----></span><br><br>R=​<span it.<!----></span><br><br>The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<span class="line"><!---->The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<span class="line"><!---->before dereferencing BrowserContext. possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<!----></span><br>before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<span class="line"><!---->before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<!----></span><br><br>The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<span class="line"><!---->The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<span class="line"><!---->before dereferencing BrowserContext.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<span class="line"><!---->NavigationPredictor holds a raw pointer to `BrowserContext *browser_context_` [1]. NavigationPredictor can continue receiving Mojo calls after BrowserContext is freed, resulting in a use after free on a virtual function pointer [2].<!----></span><br><br>Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<span class="line"><!---->Note: This feature is "disabled" on desktop but is still reachable because it is only protected by a DCHECK on the browser process side [3]. On android this vulnerability is reachable through blink [4] (without mojoJS bindings).<!----></span><br><br>[1] -<span class="line"><!---->[1] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=116;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[2] -<span class="line"><!---->[2] -<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=509;drc=9b4c3eeaeed2c0cf9b3911c69417cdbde5105778<!----></a><br>[3] - <span class="line"><!---->[3] - <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/navigation_predictor.cc;l=507;drc=7a353f20acd7f7973d3e5113247afe7109f3f58e<!----></a><br>[4] - cooler<span class="line"><!---->No user interaction (extension) - cooler<!----></span><br>1. Install the attached extension (ext) and allow in incognito <span class="line"><!---->1. Install the attached extension (ext) and allow in incognito <!----></span>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api"><!---->https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60842000/how-to-get-windowid-from-chrome-incognito-window-with-chrome-api<!----></a><br>2. Host child.html with a web server<span class="line"><!---->2. Host child.html with a web server<!----></span><br>3. python copy_mojo_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/src/out/x64.asan mojo<span class="line"><!---->3. python copy_mojo_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/src/out/x64.asan mojo<!----></span><br>4. run ./out/x64.asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --ignore-certificate-errors --load-extension=/path/to/ext<span class="line"><!---->4. run ./out/x64.asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --ignore-certificate-errors --load-extension=/path/to/ext<!----></span><br><br>Note: Allow incognito is just needed because I'm using the chrome.windows api to simulate closing a browser window.<span class="line"><!---->Note: Allow incognito is just needed because I'm using the chrome.windows api to simulate closing a browser window.<!----></span><br><br>User interaction (exit browser)<span class="line"><!---->User interaction (exit browser)<!----></span><br>1. Host child.html with a web server<span class="line"><!---->1. Host child.html with a web server<!----></span><br>2. Open incognito browser (can be another chrome instance, guest view, etc - we just need two BrowserContext instances)<span class="line"><!---->2. Open incognito browser (can be another chrome instance, guest view, etc - we just need two BrowserContext instances)<!----></span><br>3. Navigate to to <span class="line"><!---->3. Navigate to to <!----></span>https://localhost:8080/child.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost:8080/child.html"><!---->https://localhost:8080/child.html<!----></a><br>4.         AFAIK we treat UaF as high severity (the example given by <span class="line"><!---->AFAIK we treat UaF as high severity (the example given by <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#TOC-High-severity<!----></a> for "Memory corruption in the browser process that can only be triggered from a compromised renderer, leading to a sandbox escape" was also a UaF)<span class="line"><!----> for "Memory corruption in the browser process that can only be triggered from a compromised renderer, leading to a sandbox escape" was also a UaF)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div><br>

        Thank you for the report!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report!<!----></span><br><br>Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <span class="line"><!---->Assigning to tbansal@ and CC'ing sofiyase@ based on <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1691705<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <span class="line"><!---->The current POC requires MojoJS, which would make us consider this a Severity-High sandbox escape. I think the interaction requirement is very small (especially on Android where IIRC application exit can occur at anytime when the app is in the background). <!----></span><br><br>I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<span class="line"><!---->I've uploaded the POC to clusterfuzz to see if it can repro there (not 100% sure). I'll do more investigation tomorrow.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Besides the feature being enabled by default, do you have ideas for how you would actually exploit this? This would raise this to a Severity-Critical, which we would be very interested in knowing about. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<span class="line"><!---->Reporter: You mentioned that this may be exploitable on Android without MojoJS. Any help here would be greatly appreciated.<!----></span><br><br>tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<span class="line"><!---->tbansal@ or others: Do you have any intuition on whether this could be exploitable via standard web APIs as well?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1197904#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Apr 12, 2021, 11:58 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1197904#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Apr 12, 2021, 11:58 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a>: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `<a href="">` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<span class="line"><!---->: I'm not sure how feasible it is to trigger without mojo bindings. The path is reachable programatically by calling `window.open("/foo.html")` if foo has `&lt;a href=""&gt;` tags in it [1]. However I'm not sure if it is possible to send enough window.open calls to cause a race between BrowserContext being freed and `NavigationPredictor::ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnLoad` being called before an android device slows down because too many windows or open.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc;l=78;drc=d5e1999ef5ebc2308f8710dc9eb4d069c3452308<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296"><!---->6b84dc72351bd7b01bf7a0987752ad160029c296<!----></a><br>Author: Brendon Tiszka <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Brendon Tiszka &lt;<!----></span>btiszka@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/btiszka@gmail.com"><!---->btiszka@gmail.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Apr 20 15:45:03 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Apr 20 15:45:03 2021<!----></span><br><br>M86-LTS: Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<span class="line"><!---->M86-LTS: Ensure that BrowserContext is not used after it has been freed<!----></span><br><br>Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<span class="line"><!---->Previously, it was possible for the BrowserContext to be destroyed<!----></span><br>before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<span class="line"><!---->before ReportAnchorElementMetricsOnClick attempted to access it.<!----></span><br><br>The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<span class="line"><!---->The fix uses the fact that NavigationPredictor extends<!----></span><br>WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsObserver and checks that web_contents is still alive<!----></span><br>before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<span class="line"><!---->before dereferencing BrowserContext. WebContents will always<!----></span><br>outlive BrowserContext.<span class="line"><!---->outlive BrowserContext.<!----></span><br><br>R=​<span class="line"><!---->R=​<!----></span>lukasza@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/lukasza@chromium.org"><!---->lukasza@chromium.org<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->,         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
